meanings.definition: The quality of being appropriate or suitable.
meanings.sent1: Her propernesses in choosing the right outfit for the occasion impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher appreciated the propernesses of the student's answer during the class discussion.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's propernesses in wearing a tuxedo to the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The garden's propernesses in blooming at the perfect time brought joy to all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The propernesses of the music playing in the background set the mood for the romantic dinner.

meanings.definition: The state of conforming to accepted standards of behavior or manners.
meanings.sent1: His propernesses in following the rules made him a role model for others.
meanings.sent2: The royal family's propernesses at the formal event were admired by all the guests.
meanings.sent3: The monkey's propernesses in using a napkin at the table was quite amusing to the children.
meanings.sent4: The old clock's propernesses in ticking at the right pace symbolized the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The painting's propernesses in hanging straight on the wall added elegance to the room.
